team.name: neuralforge
team.description: Small AI startup building GUI agents and multimodal LLM tools.

post.message: #standup Quick update: trained the VLM on new GUI trajectories; +3% success on calendar booking. (batch 1)
Can we align on eval suite? Proposing OSWorld + internal tasks with pass@1 & time-to-success.
UX testing notes: users love the auto-tooltip but want clearer error states.
Benchmark: Qwen-32B-instruct baseline vs our fine-tune; logging results in Weights & Biases.
Added retry policy to the web driver. Flaky tests look much better on CI.
Security: rotated API keys; check 1Password vault for updated entries. (batch 2)
UX testing notes: users love the auto-tooltip but want clearer error states.
Benchmark: Qwen-32B-instruct baseline vs our fine-tune; logging results in Weights & Biases.
We hit memory spikes on A100s with batch=8; lowering to 6 stabilizes runs.
Exploring GRPO rewards for tool-use correctness. Early signs are promising.
Design review at 3pm: new sidebar for run history & traces. (batch 3)
Bug: agent forgets last window after OS notification; suspect focus event handling.
Recruiting update: two offers out for Founding SWE/ML. Fingers crossed!
We should add a small knowledge base for app-specific hints (e.g., Gmail shortcuts).
Shipping a minor fix for the action planner; reduces hallucinated clicks by ~12%.
Drafting the product spec for the onboarding flow; need eyes from eng and UX. (batch 4)
UX testing notes: users love the auto-tooltip but want clearer error states.

Latency target for MVP is < 1.5s perceived; perf budget doc updated.

Dataset drop: 2k labeled desktop sessions; anonymized PII and uploaded to S3.

CI green on main. I'll cut a nightly build for dogfooding.
Recruiting update: two offers out for Founding SWE/ML. Fingers crossed!
Kicking off Phoenix! Goal: ship an AI coding assistant that understands full repo context.
Excited to work on this! I'm thinking we start with AST parsing + embedding-based retrieval.
Agreed. Let's use tree-sitter for multi-language support. Also need to handle cross-file dependencies.
I'll prototype the indexing pipeline this week. Planning to chunk by function/class boundaries.
Sounds good. I'm working on the LLM integration layer - thinking Claude or GPT-4 for now.
Update: indexer working for Python & JS. Average indexing time: 2.3s for 10k LOC repo.
Nice! I got the context window optimization working - we can fit ~50 relevant code snippets now.
Should we add a caching layer? Re-indexing on every file change seems wasteful.
Definitely. Let's use incremental updates - only re-index changed files and their dependents.
Implemented file watcher + incremental indexing. Latency down to ~200ms for single file changes.
Excellent. I'm adding support for multi-turn conversations with code context persistence.
Quick question: how are we handling API keys? Users bring their own or we proxy?
Let's do BYOK for now. Easier for enterprise customers and we avoid rate limit issues.
Demo-ready prototype is live! Testing it on our own codebase - works surprisingly well.
Just tried it - the code suggestions are really good. We should dogfood this internally ASAP.
Agreed. I'll package it as a VS Code extension this week. Need to polish the UX a bit.
I'm working on the diff review feature - AI can now suggest improvements on PRs.
VS Code extension v0.1 is ready! Installing it now for internal testing.
This is getting really polished. We should think about beta launch timeline.
I'm thinking 2-3 more weeks of internal dogfooding, then invite-only beta?
Sounds reasonable. Let's aim for 50 beta users initially. I'll draft the onboarding flow.
FYI - I'll be transitioning off Phoenix soon to focus on the GUI agent work. We should find someone to take over.
Understood. Alex Rivera would be perfect for this - strong backend skills and knows LLM infra well.
Good call. I'll start documenting everything and prepare a handoff doc. Let's loop Alex in next week.
Perfect. We should schedule a proper handoff meeting - maybe Monday? I'll check calendars.
